Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip black; dilute brown band at top of handle zone; black-figure decoration consisting of part of lion to right with open mouth and tail curled over back (added red mane, two spots on body and tongue; added white teeth; lower body and legs lost except for trace of raised left foreleg).
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the lip cup, Munich 2150 (CVA Munich 10, pl. 13, no. 8; Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 97, fig. 12.8).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.36)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 408, no. B620)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0518) (Phase 1)
